column4: When Jaunty (whatever it is) releases , will it be possible to go Hardy -> Jaunty ?
or is that not known at this time ?
You'll have to go through Intrepid.
8.10 uh.. lets see how I can put it..
Is worthless to me
If you want to upgrade to 9.04, you'll have to upgrade through it, even if its only for a few minutes.
You can upgrade with a CD (the alternate CD)
I mean , will the issues of Intrepid be there in Jaunty , or will they be fixed?
#ubuntu+1 is the place to go to ask Jaunty questions right now.  I have no idea.
Certainly nothing wrong with that.  Especially if nothing in the newer versions strikes you as must-have
Any idea on a LTS release ?  Perhaps after Jaunty ?
10.04 is the next LTS
Not only that, but in all likelyhood it'll be the 22nd
April 22nd ?
I believe its (as a rule of thumb, not a rule, mind you) the penultimate Thursday of the month.
You can.  You'll need to boot to the liveCD and resize/move stuff with gparted
Just go to the installer and click "manual" and resize it up how I want it, then quit the install ?
Before I actually go to install anything ?
no, no.  Don't start the installer at all.  Go to System > Administration > Gnome PArtition MAnager
I don't see that in the installed version I have , would it be possible for me just to do it now?  IE: get gparted
You can't modify the partitions you're using.  So while you would be able to shrink the windows partition, you would still have to use a liveCD to expand the others.
I was under the impression that they had it installed by default, but if not, you'll simply have to install gparted on the liveCD
Perhaps it's not on the installed version by default ?
